channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: Iranian Protesters Ransack Saudi Embassy After Execution of Shiite Cleric
item.description: The execution of Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, an outspoken campaigner for Shiite rights, is likely to exacerbate sectarian tensions across the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: Shiites carrying a placard with an image of Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr at a protest in Srinagar, in the disputed region of Kashmir, on Saturday.

item.title: Untangling an Accounting Tool and an Ancient Incan Mystery
item.description: Archaeologists have made a discovery they hope could help unravel one of the most tenacious mysteries of ancient Peru: how to read the knotted string records, known as khipus, kept by the Incas.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM NEUMAN
item.media:description: Patricia Landa, an archaeological conservator, painstakingly cleans and untangles the khipus at her house in Lima.

item.title: Xinjiang Seethes Under Chinese Crackdown
item.description: The Chinese government has introduced unprecedented measures aimed at shaping the behavior and beliefs of China’s 10 million Uighurs.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW JACOBS
item.media:credit: Adam Dean for The New York Times
item.media:description: A Uighur woman in the old city of Kashgar, in Xinjiang Province. Uighurs, a Turkic Muslim minority concentrated in the region, complain that China is slowly erasing their culture.

item.title: China Grants Courts Greater Autonomy on Limited Matters
item.description: China has been making significant reforms to its legal system, but many people see the past year as a period of retreat, rather than advance, in China’s effort to establish the rule of law.
item.dc:creator: IAN JOHNSON

item.title: Jihadists Deepen Collaboration in North Africa
item.description: The active coordination is turning one of the most inhospitable territories on earth into a complex security challenge for African and global forces.
item.category: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
item.dc:creator: CARLOTTA GALL
item.media:description: France has deployed hundreds of troops in northern Niger to create a buffer against jihadist advances from Libya.

item.title: Turkey Says Hitler Comment by President Erdogan Was ‘Distorted’
item.description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who seeks to imbue his largely ceremonial office with sweeping powers, had cited Hitler when asked whether a strong presidency was possible in Turkey.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU
item.media:description: A poster of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey in Istanbul.

item.title: Group Claiming to Oppose ISIS Says It Committed Cyberattack on BBC
item.description: The group of hackers said the attack, which shut down the broadcaster’s digital services for a few hours on Thursday, was intended as a test of its own abilities.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: On Perilous Migrant Trail, Women Often Become Prey to Sexual Abuse
item.description: Along with all the perils refugees face, women have added accounts of being assaulted, traumas that do not end with their arrival in Europe.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:credit: Djamila Grossman for The New York Times
item.media:description: A 35-year-old Syrian refugee, Samar, in November with her three daughters, then 2, 8 and 13, at a shelter in Berlin. “Everybody knows there are two ways of paying the smugglers,” she said. “With money or with your body.” Samir refused a smuggler's advances in Turkey, and was threatened.

item.title: Gunmen Killed in Pathankot, India, Air Base Attack
item.description: At least four attackers were killed as Indian authorities defended the base in Punjab. Several Indian security force members were also reported dead.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR

item.title: Qaeda Affiliate Uses Video of Donald Trump for Recruiting
item.description: A video by the Shabab, Al Qaeda’s Somalia branch, criticizes racism in America and features footage of Mr. Trump announcing a plan to bar Muslims from entering the country.
item.dc:creator: LIAM STACK
item.media:description: Donald J. Trump speaking during a campaign stop in Council Bluffs, Iowa, on Tuesday.

item.title: World Briefing: India: Gunmen Attack Air Base
item.description: At least two attackers were killed when they entered an Indian air force base near the border with Pakistan and exchanged fire with security forces.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Gunman Kills 2 in Tel Aviv in Attack on a Busy Street
item.description: An intense manhunt was underway for the man who opened fire on a packed commercial street.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID
item.media:description: Israeli police officers at the scene of a shooting outside a bar in central Tel Aviv. Two were killed and at least five others were hurt.

item.title: World Briefing: The Philippines: Hundreds Injured in Revelry
item.description: New Year’s firecrackers left one dead and 380 injured, and caused a fire that gutted 1,000 dwellings.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Saudi Arabia: Executions Rise
item.description: The authorities carried out at least 157 executions in 2015, with beheadings reaching their highest level in two decades, advocacy groups said.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Israel: Military Returns Bodies of Palestinians Linked to Attacks
item.description: Israel had been withholding the bodies of suspected attackers as a tactic meant to crack down on violence.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Egypt: 15 Bodies Are Recovered After Ferry Sinks in Nile River
item.description: Two other people were still missing after a small ferryboat sank on New Year’s Eve.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: 2 Sentenced to Death in Killing of Bangladeshi Activist in 2013
item.description: Six others were given prison terms in the killing of Rajib Haider, a secular blogger and activist who was a critic of the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami.
item.dc:creator: JULFIKAR ALI MANIK
item.media:credit: Munir Uz Zaman/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Some of the defendants charged in the 2013 murder of Rajib Haider, a secular blogger and activist, being escorted by the police in Dhaka on Thursday. Six of the accused received prison terms.

item.title: Taliban Attack Kabul Restaurant, Setting Off Shootout
item.description: The first attack of the new year began with a bomb blast at the restaurant, in a neighborhood where many foreigners live. A 12-year-old boy was killed.
item.dc:creator: AHMAD SHAKIB and ROD NORDLAND
item.media:description: The attack on a French restaurant in Kabul, Le Jardin, began with a bombing.

item.title: U.S. Doesn’t Know How Many Foreign Visitors Overstay Visas
item.description: After two decades of failed attempts to track such visitors, some officials call the visa program a critical national security weakness.
item.dc:creator: RON NIXON
item.media:description: Alan Bersin, the assistant secretary for international affairs at the Department of Homeland Security, during a House hearing in December on the screening of visa applicants in the wake of terrorist attacks.

item.title: The Saturday Profile: Nostalgia and Surrealism Infuse Works of Chinese Animation Artist
item.description: The films of Zhang Xiaotao try to show what the intense pressure to achieve wealth and success in modern China does to the soul.
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ
item.media:credit: Sim Chi Yin for The New York Times
item.media:description: Zhang Xiaotao in a graffiti-filled tunnel outside his studio in Beijing's 798 arts district.
